alert.note: Alert for Berks; Bucks; Lehigh; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 3:58PM EDT until July 09 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL BERKS, SOUTHEASTERN LEHIGH, NORTHWESTERN BUCKS, AND NORTH CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 358 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain. At 2 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooded roadways and water rescues around Quakertown. With more rain about to move in, flash flooding is likely. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Emmaus, Quakertown, East Greenville, Bally, Green Lane, Pleasant Valley, Geryville, Zionsville, Pennsburg, Coopersburg, Red Hill, and Richlandtown. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 38 and 51. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
